question_text: What subject does FR 121 address?
option_a: An Officer Controlling Expenditure is delegated authority by an Accounting Officer to control a sub-head or specified amount of expenditure.
option_b: Officers are personally and financially responsible for proper performance of financial duties and accurate public accounts.
option_c: Accounting Officers must seek Accountant-General advice on unclear matters and cannot depart from regulations without concurrence.
option_d: Delegating duties does not relieve an officer of responsibility for financial functions.
explanation: FR 121 provides that An Officer Controlling Expenditure is delegated authority by an Accounting Officer to control a sub-head or specified amount of expenditure.
